questions.question: Which best describes the Main Character and Narrator  of 1984

choices.answer: Wilson Suthers. He is 39 years old. He works in the Ministry of Peace
Winston Smith. He is 39 years old. He works in the Ministry of Truth
Warren Pierce. He is 22 years old. He owns a small business
Warton Parish. He is 25 years old. He lives in London, England

questions.question: What is the Setting of the Novel

choices.answer: A dystopian future set in the North American Alliance
A utopian future set in New York City, the capital of New America
A dystopian future set London, a city in a province of Oceania
a utopian future set in Paris, a city in the super-nation of Eurasia

questions.question: Which of the following IS NOT a party slogan?

choices.answer: Love is Hate
War is Peace
Ignorance is Strength
Freedom is Slavery

questions.question: For what Jobs and Protects is the Ministry of Love responsible?

choices.answer: (Lies) = Entertainment, News, Education, and Propaganda
(Poverty) = Economy, rations, and quality of life
(War) = Soldiers, military, and combat actions
(Hate) = Police, Prisons, brainwashing

questions.question: When Winston first sees "the girl with dark hair" he immediately likes and trusts her.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: What changes Winston's mind about the "girl with dark hair" ?

choices.answer: She follows him home at night
She passes him a love note at work
She turns him in to the Thought Police
She lies to protect him

questions.question: Who is the Inner Party member that Winston sees at work during the 2 Minutes hate?

choices.answer: Syme
Parsons
Goldstein
Obrien

questions.question: Identify the symbol - it represents over-surveillance and invasion of privacy. In is in almost every home and workplace

choices.answer: Memory hole
Telescreen
Spycam
Iphone

questions.question: Name this Symbol - it represents the beauty and uselessness of the past AND the fragility of Winston and Julia's love

choices.answer: Paperweight
Mirror
Diary
Painting of the Church

questions.question: Name this Symbol - it shows outward loss of identity and obedience to the Party. Taking it off represents freedom

choices.answer: Makeup
Diary
Sunglasses
Uniform

questions.question: Name this Symbol - It represents a search for truth/freedom of thought AND a rebellion against 'correct' thoughts

choices.answer: Paperweight
Picture of Church
Diary
Uniform

questions.question: What is the 'Goal' of Newspeak?

choices.answer: To remove words and reduce the range of thoughts/ideas in citizens
To add new words and ideas to the language
to increase intelligence and communication in citizens
To have a language that no one in Eastasia or Eurasia can understand

questions.question: Winston believes that the only way to overthrow/end the Party is

choices.answer: the strength and endurance of the Proles in a rebellion
From inside the leadership of the Inner Party
he believes from the beginning that it is totally impossible
An invasion from the army of another country

questions.question: The party encourages people to marry and form loving relationships. It makes them easier to control and threaten

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: What is the "most essential command" that allows the Party to "control reality"

choices.answer: The Party tells ppl to kill their enemies
The Party tell ppl to reject the truth of their eyes and ears
The party tells ppl to love each other
The party tell ppl to vote and keep BB in office

questions.question: What is special about the Spare Room above the antique junk shop?

choices.answer: It smells like garbage and is filled with insects
It reminds him of home and his dead mother
There is no telescreen and it feels nostalgic
The furniture is brand new and modern

questions.question: Name the Symbol - it represents an escape from the present OR fantasy of the past. It provides privacy and security

choices.answer: The paperweight
The diary
The spare room
the telescreen

questions.question: "Unorthodoxy" means

choices.answer: Following the rules/beliefs well
Not following the rules/beliefs well
practicing religion in secret
mis-ordering a list of items

questions.question: The names of the Ministries vs. their real function (peace = war, plenty = poverty, truth = lies) is an example of:

choices.answer: Juxtaposition
Metaphor
Imagery
Paradox

questions.question: Winston asks Julia what made her want to love/sleep with him. What is her answer?

choices.answer: He looked strong and intelligent
His face seemed like her dead fathers
His face showed he was against the Party
He looked like fun-loving person

questions.question: How does Julia feel about the Party/Governement?

choices.answer: She loves the Party, loves BB and follows all the rules
She is afraid of the Party and wants to escape
She does not care about the Government at all. She is too stupid
She hates the Party and enjoys "corrupting" other people into rule breaking

questions.question: Name the Symbol - it represents purity, love, nature, and heaven. It is in dreams and where Winston had sex with Julia.

choices.answer: Golden Country
The Riverwalk
The Cafeteria
Room 101

questions.question: Winstons sexual acts with Julia are:

choices.answer: An Intimate and Spiritual connection of faith
A Passionate but Meaningless and Selfish encounter
A step towards a Hopeful future filled with children
A Rebellious and Political act against the Party

questions.question: What symbols represent Julia's rebellion against the Party?

choices.answer: Sleeping in a real bed and remembering her dead family
Real cigarettes, coffee, and black-market wine
Enjoying sex, wearing makeup, and taking off her uniform
Reading original editions of forbidden books

questions.question: Winston tells Julia the "real betrayal" will be if the Party can force them to:

choices.answer: Steal from Mr. Charrington
Stop loving each other
Tell lies about OBrien
Get others to join the Brotherhood

questions.question: Newspeak word = to have two contradictory thoughts at the same time and accept both = deny *reality* and believe Party

choices.answer: Crimestop
Blackwhite
Speakwrite
Doublethink

questions.question: 2+2 =5 is an example of Double-Think and Reality Control

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: What happens to the Glass Paperweight? how is that symbolic?

choices.answer: Julia hides it from Winston, like how she hides her feelings
It is shattered by the police, like how Winston and Julia's relationship
Mr. Charrington steals it, like how he stole Julia from Winston
Winston hides it in his pocket, like how he is protecting Julia

questions.question: According to Obrien, why is Winston in the Ministry of Love? What will they do to him?

choices.answer: Torture and punish him for his crimes
Starve him and publicly execute him
Remove his emotions/humanity and make him loyal
Brainwash him and turn him into a spy in the Brotherhood

questions.question: What what reason does the Party want power?

choices.answer: To have power and eternal control over all humans
To create equality and safety for all humans
To have a happy and free society of perfection
to destroy humanity and kill the whole earth

questions.question: What kind of world does the Party want to create

choices.answer: A world of equality and safety for all loyal memebers
a world where all humans are dead and destroyed
A world of hatred, cruelty, and triumph ruled by BB
A world of technology and perfection ruled by the Inner Party

questions.question: What is Winston's secret hope/fantasy to keep his "freedom" while in the Ministry of Love?

choices.answer: He plans to escape with Julia to Eurasia
He plans to be shot while hating BB
He plans to betray Julia and save himself
He plans to commit suicide with a razor blade

questions.question: What is Room 101

choices.answer: An execution squad
a barrel of lobsters
a persons greatest fear
Big Brother's home

questions.question: What is the only way for Winston to save himself from the Rats?

choices.answer: He must sacrifice Julia in his place
He must humiliate himself completely
He must confess he does not love Julia anymore
He cannot save himself at all
